required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of 177Lu-Anti-ED-B mAbs SPECT Imaging in Patients With ED-B Positive Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Safety Study of 177Lu-Anti-ED-B mAbs SPECT Imaging in Patients With ED-B Positive Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single arm study to evaluate the safety and biodistribution of 177Lu-labeled anti-ED-B mAbs SPECT imaging in patients with ED-B positive solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: After being fully informed about the study and potential risks, all patients giving written informed consent will be evaluated to determine eligibility for study entry. Patients will receive an injection of 177Lu-labeled anti-ED-B mAbs and will undergo SPECT/CT scanning to determine uptake of 177Lu-labeled anti-ED-B mAbs in tumor lesions and normal tissues and organs.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of tissue distribution of 177Lu-Anti-ED-B mAbs(B5-IgG4)
primary_outcome.description: Biodistribution of 177Lu-Anti-ED-B mAbs(B5-IgG4) evaluated by radioactive uptake values (standardized uptake values, SUVs) in various organs during repeated 177Lu-SPECT scans will be reported.
Absorbed dose (radioactive uptake) estimates for different organs and tissues calculated with the AUCs and the OLINDA/EXM dosimetry program will be obtained and reported.
Safety will be assessed by evaluation of incidence of adverse events.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive a tracer (5 mg, IV) dose of 177Lu (10 mCi) labeled anti-ED-B mAbs(177Lu-B5-IgG4)
